name: AnnotationArrayBuilder
description: The ClassBuilder.AnnotationBuilder.AnnotationArrayBuilder class is a specialized builder for constructing array properties within annotation definitions. This builder allows you to add elements to annotation arrays, supporting various data types including strings, primitives, enums, classes, and nested annotations.
overview:
AnnotationArrayBuilder instances are obtained through the putArray() method of AnnotationBuilder and provide a fluent API for adding array elements before finalizing the array and returning to the parent annotation builder.

Obtaining an AnnotationArrayBuilder:
AnnotationArrayBuilder instances are created through the putArray() method.

Usage Examples:
The builder supports adding various types of arrays, including simple string arrays, mixed primitive arrays, class arrays, enum arrays, complex annotations with multiple array properties, field annotations with arrays, method annotations with parameter arrays, single element arrays, and even empty arrays.

Supported Element Types:
Primitive Types: boolean, byte, char, short, int, long, float, double.
Reference Types: String, Class<?>, Enum.

Array Limitations:
All elements in an array must be of the same type. Mixed-type arrays are not supported in Java annotations. Array elements are added in the order they are specified. Arrays can be empty (call finish() without adding any elements).

Type Safety:
The builder enforces type consistency within arrays. Attempting to add elements of different types to the same array will result in compilation errors when the annotation is finalized.

Best Practices:
1. Consistent Types: Ensure all elements in an array are of the same type as required by the annotation definition.
2. Order Matters: Elements are added to arrays in the order they are specified.
3. Empty Arrays: Call finish() without adding elements to create empty arrays where supported.
4. Complete Arrays: Always call finish() to complete the array definition.
5. Annotation Completion: Remember to call finish() on the parent AnnotationBuilder as well.

Related Classes:
- ClassBuilder.AnnotationBuilder - Parent builder that creates AnnotationArrayBuilder instances
- ClassBuilder - Main class builder
- ClassBuilder.FieldBuilder - Field builder that supports annotations
- ClassBuilder.MethodBuilder - Method builder that supports annotations

The AnnotationArrayBuilder provides a type-safe and convenient way to construct complex array properties within Java annotations, enabling rich metadata specification for generated classes.

methods.name: putString
methods.description: Adds a string element to the annotation array.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The string value to add to the array

methods.name: putInt
methods.description: Adds an integer element to the annotation array.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The integer value to add to the array

methods.name: putLong
methods.description: Adds a long element to the annotation array.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The long value to add to the array

methods.name: putDouble
methods.description: Adds a double element to the annotation array.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The double value to add to the array

methods.name: putFloat
methods.description: Adds a float element to the annotation array.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The float value to add to the array

methods.name: putBoolean
methods.description: Adds a boolean element to the annotation array.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The boolean value to add to the array

methods.name: putByte
methods.description: Adds a byte element to the annotation array.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The byte value to add to the array

methods.name: putShort
methods.description: Adds a short element to the annotation array.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The short value to add to the array

methods.name: putChar
methods.description: Adds a char element to the annotation array.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The char value to add to the array (single character)

methods.name: putClass
methods.description: Adds a Class element to the annotation array.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The Class object to add to the array

methods.name: putEnum
methods.description: Adds an enum element to the annotation array.

methods.name: finish
methods.description: Finalizes the array and returns to the parent AnnotationBuilder. This method must be called to apply the array to the annotation property. After calling finish(), the array is finalized and the builder returns to the annotation context. The annotation builder may need to be finalized again with its own finish() call.
